intro: Notanthera attenuatus, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Notanthera attenuatus is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
